intro: Hieracium caledon, commonly known as the Caledonian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the northern regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils and can be found in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months. Hieracium caledon is known for its ability to thrive in cooler climates and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
